cheatsheet.title: Generate an advanced interface for the models

intro.description: The Extended Editing Framework (EEF) give you the ability to generate very quickly an advanced user interface.

item.title: Install EEF
item.description:
You can download EEF from the Eclipse update site of your Eclipse version, for example http://download.eclipse.org/indigo for Eclipse 3.7 Indigo. EEF can be found in the modeling category along with over EMF-based tools.
To learn more about EEF installation process, have a look at the EEF wiki: http://wiki.eclipse.org/EEF/Installation_Guide

item.title: Generate the EEF models
item.description: Right click on your genmodel and select "EEF" -> "Initialize EEF models" and after that select "EEF" -> "Initialize EEF editor models". Now open the MANIFEST.MF of your ".editor" project, go to the dependencies tab and add there a dependency to org.eclipse.emf.eef.runtime

item.title: Generate a form-based editor
item.description: Right click on the "eefgen" model and generate the editor. Launch an new Eclipse runtime (right click on the project and select Run As -> Eclipse Application) In the new Eclipse, create a new model by using the new wizard under the Example EMF wizard category. The EEF editor should open.
